intro: Cayaponia ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty cayaponia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, reddish stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. Cayaponia ferruginea is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
